title: create-sibling --existing=reconfigure  should git-annex init remote if local has git-annex and remote doesn't
body:
#### What is the problem?
In preparation to 0.10 release, I would need to migrate some datasets from pure git into annex.  Logical way to propagate those changes would be to `create-sibling --existing=reconfigure ` or alike to remote end also becomes git-annex repos.  But apparently even in reconfigure mode we just complain that it is not annex and do not initialize it: e.g. how it looks in master (in 0.9.x a bit different but to the same extent)

```shell
$> datalad --dbg create-sibling --inherit -s datalad-public --existing=reconfigure
[INFO   ] Connecting ...                                               
[INFO   ] Considering to create a target dataset /mnt/btrfs/datasets/datalad/crawl/dicoms/dartmouth-phantoms at /srv/datasets.datalad.org/www/dicoms/dartmouth-phantoms of datasets.datalad.org 
[INFO   ] Target path /srv/datasets.datalad.org/www/dicoms/dartmouth-phantoms already exists. And it fails to rmdir (rmdir: failed to remove ���/srv/datasets.datalad.org/www/dicoms/dartmouth-phantoms���: Directory not empty). Will only reconfigure 
[INFO   ] Updating dataset '/mnt/btrfs/datasets/datalad/crawl/dicoms/dartmouth-phantoms' ... 
[INFO   ] Inherited publish_depends from <Dataset path=/mnt/btrfs/datasets/datalad/crawl/dicoms>: ('refs/heads/*', 'refs/tags/*', 'refs/heads/*') 
[INFO   ] Configure additional default publication refspec "refs/heads/*" 
[INFO   ] Configure additional default publication refspec "refs/tags/*" 
[INFO   ] Configure additional default publication refspec "refs/heads/*" 
[INFO   ] Failed to enable annex remote datalad-public, could be a pure git 
[WARNING] Failed to determine if datalad-public carries annex. 
.: datalad-public(-) [ssh://datasets.datalad.org/srv/datasets.datalad.org/www/dicoms/dartmouth-phantoms (git)]
[INFO   ] Adjusting remote git configuration 
[INFO   ] Enabling git post-update hook ... 
[INFO   ] Running post-update hooks in all created siblings 
create_sibling(ok): . (dataset)

```
so it seems I would need to `git annex init ` on remote manually for now
